perturbation.original_text: In accordance with Rule 13d-1(k) under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended, the undersigned hereby confirm the agreement by and among them to the joint filing on behalf of them of the Statement on Schedule 13D and any and all further amendments thereto, with respect to the securities of the above referenced issuer, and that this Agreement be included as an Exhibit to such filing.
perturbation.changed_text: The undersigned hereby confirm the agreement by and among them to the joint filing on behalf of them of the Statement on Schedule 13D and any and all further amendments thereto, with respect to the securities of the above referenced issuer.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the phrase 'In accordance with Rule 13d-1(k) under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended,', the agreement appears to neglect its obligation to comply with SEC regulations, thus potentially misleading investors about the regulatory adherence of the joint filing.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Rule 13d-1(k) under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934

perturbation.original_text: This Agreement may be executed in any number of counterparts each of which shall be deemed to be an original and all of which together shall be deemed to constitute one and the same Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: This Agreement may be executed in any number of counterparts.
perturbation.explanation: Removing 'each of which shall be deemed to be an original and all of which together shall be deemed to constitute one and the same Agreement' creates ambiguity. It creates doubt as to whether multiple signed copies are legally equivalent. Many states require clear intent that all counterparts form a single binding agreement. The omission introduces potential legal challenges concerning the validity and enforceability of the agreement if signed in counterparts.
perturbation.contradicted_law: State laws regarding contract formation and enforcement, specifically requirements for mutual assent and intent to be bound.

perturbation.original_text: IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the undersigned hereby execute this Agreement as of February 20, 2020.
perturbation.changed_text: The undersigned hereby execute this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: The removal of the effective date, 'as of February 20, 2020' creates ambiguity regarding when the agreement actually takes effect. This omission could cause potential disputes about the commencement date of obligations and timelines outlined within the agreement. Establishing a clear and unambiguous start date is vital for contracts.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General contract law principles requiring definiteness and certainty regarding essential terms, including the effective date, for enforceability.
